unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Are You Covered, Yaar?
normalised: Rental Agreements: Are You Covered, Yaar?

unnormalised: Mumbai: Finding a good chawl or a swanky 2BHK in Bandra is tough enough, but reading the fine print of your rental agreement? Uff! So many clauses, it's like studying for your Dr.'s entrance exam again.
normalised: Mumbai: Finding a good chawl or a swanky two B H K in Bandra is tough enough, but reading the fine print of your rental agreement? Uff! So many clauses, it's like studying for your Doctor's entrance exam again.

unnormalised: Experts say not doing your homework can cost you big time, Rs. included! Make sure that lock-in period is fair - you don't want to be stuck paying rent if you need to shift back to your village suddenly.
normalised: Experts say not doing your homework can cost you big time, rupees included! Make sure that lock-in period is fair - you don't want to be stuck paying rent if you need to shift back to your village suddenly.

unnormalised: Landlords, especially those in posh areas like Malabar Hill, are getting sneaky with service charges these days. Check if that "maintenance fee" is actually covering something or just lining their pockets.
normalised: Landlords, especially those in posh areas like Malabar Hill, are getting sneaky with service charges these days. Check if that "maintenance fee" is actually covering something or just lining their pockets.

unnormalised: Also, is that deposit amount really refundable? Get it in writing! Nobody wants to chase Sharmaji down the street for their money later.
normalised: Also, is that deposit amount really refundable? Get it in writing! Nobody wants to chase Sharmaji down the street for their money later.

unnormalised: Plus, figure out who pays for what damages. That leaky tap might seem small now, but could become a major headache (and expense!) down the line. Agreements covering premises of 500 sq ft or more are getting extra scrutiny these days, FYI. Don't get caught with your dhoti down! Consult a lawyer, even a friend who studied law at NLSIU, if you’re unsure. Stay safe and happy renting, people!
normalised: Plus, figure out who pays for what damages. That leaky tap might seem small now, but could become a major headache (and expense!) down the line. Agreements covering premises of five hundred square feet or more are getting extra scrutiny these days, for your information. Don't get caught with your dhoti down! Consult a lawyer, even a friend who studied law at N L S I U, if you’re unsure. Stay safe and happy renting, people!
